content.prompt: Which of the following statements best explains why the average temperature of London is warmer than that of Calgary in December?

choices.label: Oceanic currents warm the atmosphere in London.
The solar radiation reaching London is more perpendicular than the solar radiation that reaches Calgary in December.
London is farther from the North Pole than Calgary is.
The Hadley cell converges over London and pushes warm air toward the surface.

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Explain environmental concepts, processes, or models in applied contexts.
